name: PB & J Thumbprint Cookies
description: PB & J Thumbprint Cookies are an irresistibly nutty twist on your classic Jam Thumbprints with protein-packed peanut butter in the dough! A must-try for PB&J fanatics. Super easy, 7 ingredients, gluten-free option, nut-free option, no Added oil

video.name: Vegan PB & J Thumbprint Cookies | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan PB & J Thumbprint Cookies

Get the WRITTEN RECIPE here - https://www.veganricha.com/vegan-pbj-thumbprint-cookies/

SUBSCRIBE HERE: https://www.youtube.com/veganricharecipes?sub_confirmation=1

Peanut Butter and Jelly Thumbprint Cookies are an irresistibly nutty twist on your classic Jam Thumbprints with protein-packed peanut butter in the dough! A must-try for PB&J fanatics. Super easy, 7 ingredients, gluten-free option, nut-free option, no Added oil

Peanut Butter & Jelly Fans, gather – you won’t be able to resist the nutty and jammy little gems I have in store for you. These yummy Vegan PB & J Thumbprint Cookies turn our favorite childhood sandwich into a tasty lunchbox treat. Perfectly paired with a glass of plant-based milk, these easy vegan cookies are a delight for the kid in every one of us.

******MORE COOKIES RECIPES FROM THE BLOG******

#vegancookies #veganpbjcookies #veganricha #easyveganreecipes

recipeIngredient: 1/2 cup smooth peanut butter (( use almond butter or cashew butter for peanut free) see notes for nutfree)
2 tbsp warmed non dairy milk (such as almond, soy, oat or coconut)
3/4 to 1 cup flour (I use a mix of 3/4 all purpose and 1/4 wheat. Use oat flour or gf blend for glutenfree)
3-4 tbsp fruit preserves (Raspberry, strawberry, cherry etc  as needed)

recipeInstructions.text: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).
recipeInstructions.name: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and preheat the oven to 350°F (180°C).

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl mix the peanut butter, warmed (to almost hot) milk, maple syrup and vanilla extract until well combined and smooth. It will take about a minute to fully come together.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl mix the peanut butter, warmed (to almost hot) milk, maple syrup and vanilla extract until well combined and smooth. It will take about a minute to fully come together.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in another bowl, then add 3/4 cup of the dry mix to the wet and make a soft sticky dough. Depending on your peanut butter and flour you might need to add a bit more flour. The dough will be soft but shouldn’t be too runny/sticky. It will get more handleable on chilling. Refrigerate the cookie dough for 15 mins. If still too sticky then add more flour.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix flour, baking soda, and salt in another bowl, then add 3/4 cup of the dry mix to the wet and make a soft sticky dough. Depending on your peanut butter and flour you might need to add a bit more flour. The dough will be soft but shouldn’t be too runny/sticky. It will get more handleable on chilling. Refrigerate the cookie dough for 15 mins. If still too sticky then add more flour.

recipeInstructions.text: Shape the dough into about an inch wide balls. Place the dough balls on a parchment-lined baking sheetz Make dents using a Measuring spoon or end of a spatula. Warm the preserves and mix with a spoon so they are not lumpy. fill the dents with warmed preserves or jam. (Warming the preserves makes it easy to fill the cookies cleanly).
recipeInstructions.name: Shape the dough into about an inch wide balls. Place the dough balls on a parchment-lined baking sheetz Make dents using a Measuring spoon or end of a spatula. Warm the preserves and mix with a spoon so they are not lumpy. fill the dents with warmed preserves or jam. (Warming the preserves makes it easy to fill the cookies cleanly).

recipeInstructions.text: Cool completely before storing. Store on the counter for up to five days Or refrigerate for up to two weeks.
recipeInstructions.name: Cool completely before storing. Store on the counter for up to five days Or refrigerate for up to two weeks.

keywords: peanut butter cookies recipe, thumbprint cookies recipe, vegan peanut butter cookies
